condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the Government capacities in resilient environmental friendly, social and infrastructure planning are strengthened responding to the most disadvantaged children and communities.

description.narrative: The Comprehensive School Safety approach was embedded in the Government's Budget and Mid-term Expenditure Programme by introducing a results based programme on Safer Schools through two budget lines for a. School Disaster Management (DRM), b. Small Size School construction and development. The Ministry of Education and Science (MoESCS) identified 22 rural-remote schools and developed a blueprint of the new school design that is inclusive, safe, resource/energy efficient and promotes community development. The Ministry launched the School DRM Programme for seven schools to implement DRM plans. UNICEF supported 52 schools in disadvantaged communities enhancing the safety and resilience of children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of child sensitive national preparedness/contingency sectoral plans developed

target.value: 2020:At least 2 sectoral plans (education, social protection) based on UNICEF CCCs are developed

title.narrative: System to track and address refugee and IDP children in the country is in place

target.value: 2020:The system is developed and introduced with adequate national capacity

actual.value: 2019:As the draft Law on Protection of Population in Emergencies panned for 2019 was not adopted by the National Parliament yet, the system will be developed in 2020.

title.narrative: Percentage of children attending seismically safe schools and preschools in line with national building codes
